remarks: Value of an operation given by a maps-to rule, deduction form, with substitution of second argument, analogous to ~ ovmpt2dxf . (Contributed by AV, 30-Mar-2019.)
statement:
ovmpt2rdx.1 $e |- ( ph -> F = ( x e. C , y e. D |-> R ) ) $.
ovmpt2rdx.2 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x = A /\ y = B ) ) -> R = S ) $.
ovmpt2rdx.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ y = B ) -> C = L ) $.
ovmpt2rdx.4 $e |- ( ph -> A e. L ) $.
ovmpt2rdx.5 $e |- ( ph -> B e. D ) $.
ovmpt2rdx.6 $e |- ( ph -> S e. X ) $.
ovmpt2rdxf.px $e |- F/ x ph $.
ovmpt2rdxf.py $e |- F/ y ph $.
ovmpt2rdxf.ay $e |- F/_ y A $.
ovmpt2rdxf.bx $e |- F/_ x B $.
ovmpt2rdxf.sx $e |- F/_ x S $.
ovmpt2rdxf.sy $e |- F/_ y S $.
ovmpt2rdxf $p |- ( ph -> ( A F B ) = S ) $.
$d A x $.
$d B y $.
$d x y $.
